sn55.9:4.2: “Sir, the monk named Asoka has died.
sn55.9:4.3: Where has he been reborn in his next life?
sn55.9:4.6: and the laywoman named Asokā have died.
sn55.9:4.7: Where have they been reborn in the next life?”
sn55.9:5.1: “Ānanda, the monk Asoka died having realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life …
sn55.9:5.2: (And all is explained as in SN 55.8)
sn55.9:6.1: This is that mirror of the teaching.
sn55.9:6.2: A noble disciple who has this may declare of themselves:
sn55.9:6.3: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am bound for awakening.’”
